body.p: comes with built-in support for some of the most common XML document types (frameworks). A sample document from each document type is displayed in the Samples tab on your Dashboard pageDashboard page.

The following built-in document types (frameworks) are included in :
DocBook - A document type standard designed for a variety of documents (particularly technical documentation). For the DocBook specifications, see .
DITA - An XML-based architecture designed for authoring, producing, and delivering technical information. For the DITA 1.3 specifications, see . You can also find a lot of helpful information in The DITA Style Guide Best Practices for Authors. includes built-in support for the latest DITA version 1.3. For more information, see .
DITA Map - A document type that collects and organizes references to DITA topics or other maps. For DITA map specifications, see .
XHTML - Extensible HyperText Markup Language includes the same depth of expression as HTML, but also conforms to XML syntax. For the W3C XHTML specifications, see .
TEI - The Text Encoding Initiative guidelines is a standard for the academic community that collectively defines an XML format for text that is primarily semantic rather than presentational. For the TEI P5 specifications, see .
